instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won’t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3: What is PPDCIN_G3? This is a typo of PPDCIN_G3H When you see PPDCIN_G3, assume they meant to type PPDCIN_G3H.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged QB300/400 overheats a lot <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 17V/20V
threads.message:
Hello community I’m Juan I’m new over here.

i have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> It came with a lot of dust and water damaged.

I clean and fixed everything and now turns on but it goes off when is about 70% of booting, if a push power it turns on again and same issue.

QB300/400 overheats and act like shorted but <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> is crested at first 17V and after couple seconds 20V.

QB300/400 will overheats depending in which USB-C IN Port I connect the charger.

Both <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> were replaced.

If I solder back the Audio Codec will overheat too but the charger sound works.
Any idea?[ATTACH type="full"]59364[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged QB300/400 overheats a lot <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 17V/20V
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

"If I solder back the Audio Codec will overheat too but the charger sound works."
I don't understand what you mean.
You didn't mention anything about audio codec before; "solder back" what???

Try to start in SMC bypass mode, as Diagnose mode too.
You may need to try clean ME BIOS, just for test.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged QB300/400 overheats a lot <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 17V/20V
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 63525, member: 682"]
First of all, welcome to the forum!

"If I solder back the Audio Codec will overheat too but the charger sound works."
I don't understand what you mean.
You didn't mention anything about audio codec before; "solder back" what???

Try to start in SMC bypass mode, as Diagnose mode too.
You may need to try clean ME BIOS, just for test.
[/QUOTE]

Originally the Mac came turning on but booting to recovery and SSD not erasing.

i did Ultrasonic and then I saw the Pp3v3 nand wasn’t present because the IC that creates it (sorry I don’t remember the name) was damaged because the water. I replace it and clean the whole area.



At some point the Audio Codec starts to overheats. I replace it and still the same if I remove it still same result.

Aftert this, Mac starts to work very weird, QB300/400 starts to act like shorted but still creates <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3</SIGNAL> and Mac only boots until 70% and goes off.

How can I start it in to Bypass mode?[ATTACH type="full"]59365[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged QB300/400 overheats a lot <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 17V/20V
threads.message:
Write directly in the reply box.
Do not click on "Reply" button; no need to quote an entire post visible few centimeters above...

So you could access macOS before ultrasonic the board?
In such case, you can have now knocked off components, or broken traces.

"How can I start it in to Bypass mode?"
Many times explained on the forum and Google also knows.
Press power butonn, connect charger and maintain pressing 5-10s...
